title: Quantum Entanglement: Definition & Implications
summary: This segment defines quantum entanglement as a phenomenon where interconnected particles instantly influence each other's states, regardless of distance. This concept is a fundamental aspect of quantum mechanics. It holds significant implications for the advancement of quantum computing. Furthermore, it is crucial for developments in quantum cryptography.

key_timestamps.note: Implications for quantum computing and cryptography

transcript_snippets: In the realm of quantum physics, entanglement is a phenomenon where pairs or groups of particles become interconnected...
No matter how far apart they are.
It's one of the cornerstone of quantum mechanics.
And has huge implications for fields like quantum computing and cryptography.
